title: Essex Live: News from around the county - BBC News
summary: ambulance crews 'feel vulnerable '' to assault over drugs .
farage accuses carswell of damaging party .
coot shot with arrow treated at animal hospital .
crossrail project disruption 'forcing businesses to close ' .
striker sammie looks forward to injury-free season at colchester .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for another week from the essex live news team on friday so goodbye and have a great weekend .
we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday , bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as they happen .
scroll down to see the news and sport we have covered today as well as the warnings about weather to come overnight .

if you have any photographs from around the county that you 'd like to share , or if there 's anything happening that you 'd like us to know about , you can contact us by clicking on the `` getting involved '' button at the top of the page .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: fatal crash driver on m11 jailed for three years
text: a lorry driver who fell asleep at the wheel has been jailed for three years .
he was found guilty at chelmsford crown court of two counts of causing death by dangerous driving in a crash on the m11 in april .
roger sharratt , 52 , of bagots oak in staffordshire , had denied the charges at a court appearance in may 2014 .
geoffrey mills , 53 , and eleanor joy mills , 45 , were killed in the collision , which happened near harlow .
police said sharratt was driving a lorry northbound along the m11 when he went into the back of a black jaguar xf car .
the jaguar then collided with a silver toyota auris , pushing it under the back of a horsebox containing five horses .
the toyota , carrying geoffrey mills and eleanor joy mills , burst into flames and further collided with a white vauxhall .
police said sharratt was driving at 55mph using cruise control and failed to react to the slowing traffic as he was likely to have been asleep .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: council puts key agencies 'on alert ' for flash flooding
text: after a yellow warning for heavy rain was issued by by the met office for many parts of eastern england , southend borough council has put key agencies and emergency services on standby .
the weather has already deteriorated in the west of the county as our weather watchers from hatfield heath shows .
but places further east have been advised to expect heavy showers and thunderstorms before fresher and drier weather follows overnight .
andy lewis , acting chief executive , said : `` residents and businesses in southend are very aware of the disruption that flash flooding can bring .
`` we hope local residents and businesses will be reassured that we are working closely together and poised to respond if necessary . ''

a spokeswoman from anglian water said : `` to ensure our southend pumping stations are in full working order anglian water teams are on the ground checking pumping station equipment and removing debris from the screens on the prittle brook .
`` we have teams on standby in anticipation of lightning strikes and power outages that may affect our pumps . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: sport : southend united denies report stadium talks had 'stalled '
text: southend united fc has denied a local press report that talks over plans for a new stadium have stalled .
the report in the echo claimed the club and its financial backer had failed to reach a `` satisfactory agreement '' .
southend united had lodged a planning application with the borough council for the stadium at fossetts farm last month .
the blues issued a statement in response that it would not make a detailed comment at this time .
but they did say `` the echo article is wholly misleading , the content is incorrect in innumerable ways and that the stadium plans are in no way affected and remain entirely on track as planned .
`` the club will be commenting further , and specifically in regard to the echo reporting , next week . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: stringer signs three for next season at clarets
text: former southampton and southend united striker lee barnard has joined chelmsford city fc .
the frontman has been at essex neighbours braintree most recently but says he ca n't wait to get started for the clarets .
`` i 'm delighted .
it 's a big club , a local club for me , and i 'm really excited to get started now , '' he said .
`` i 've spoken to rod stringer before , i know about the club , it 's ambition , and it 's something that i want to be a part of .
`` i 'm 32 now , even at my age i want to win things and do well .
the whole thing about chelmsford is going in the right direction and i 'm pleased to be a part of it . ''
he 's one of three new signings made in the past 24 hours by manager rod stringer .
defender paul rodgers , 27 , who came through the youth system at arsenal , joins from bishop 's stortford and michael west , a 26-year-old midfielder , joins the clarets from crewe .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: prime minister 'weather cock and not a signpost ' , farage claims
text: relaxing with his trademark british pint of beer in his hand during a campaigning visit to clacton , former ukip leader nigel farage accused the prime minister of being a `` weather cock and not a signpost '' .
his confidence in theresa may 's ability to deliver on brexit is falling by the day , he said .

he had joined the party 's candidate for clacton paul oakley for a morning of campaigning just as the news broke that tory candidate craig mackinlay , who beat him to the south thanet seat two years ago , had been charged over allegations relating to his 2015 election expenses .
mr farage described margaret thatcher as a signpost who knew the direction to take , but likened the current prime minister to someone who `` blows around in the wind '' .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: weather : heavy rain after bright morning
text: in a matter of a few hours early morning skies full of fine weather promise have disappeared and parts of the county were plunged into rainy gloom by lunchtime as out bbc weather watchers ' reveal .
expected heavy downpours could lead to surface water flooding and difficult driving conditions in places .
the heavy showers will ease overnight though lighter rain is likely at times .
maximum temperature : 24c ( 75f )
more details from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: sport : striker sammie looks forward to injury-free season at colchester
text: colchester united striker sammie szmodics wants an injury-free season after breaking his leg playing at crewe earlier this year .
he says he 's now looking forward to returning to training after being given the 'all clear ' by doctors .
immediately after leaving hospital on thursday morning , he told the club 's website : `` i 'm buzzing .
i 've had four or five x-rays now and thankfully , we now know the fibula has completely healed .
`` i can crack on with my running and the summer work and then look forward to pre-season again , '' the 21-year-old said .
`` i 've had two really bad injuries in the past year but i 'm raring to go again .
`` one of my main goals this coming season is to be completely injury-free and have a first ever professional season without getting injured all the way through . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cricket : wagner to leave this month but date not set
text: essex 's overseas player neil wagner is to leave the club this month but has said he 's loved every minute of his spell at the county ground in chelmsford .
the new zealand test left-armer has been signed for just the first half of the season .
he is leaving this month to accommodate the arrival of mohammad amir , fresh from pakistan duty in the champions trophy .
wagner 's exact departure date depends on the club 's progress in the royal london cup .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: coot shot with arrow treated at animal hospital
text: a coot that was shot with an arrow through its skin under one wing is being treated for a badly infected wound at south essex wildlife hospital and may need surgery .
the bird was spotted by a member of the public walking his dog by a lake next to mollands lane , in south ockendon on monday , who called the rspca .
the charity has asked anyone with information about what happened to contact them .
rspca inspector clare dew and south essex wildlife hospital vet tom linsel paddled out to the middle of the lake to catch the injured bird .
animal collection officer joe white said : `` this is a horrifying incident that highlights the cruelty of some people .
`` we suspect that this poor bird was shot some days ago and has been suffering ever since , '' he said .
the penalties faced if caught deliberately injuring a wild animal can be up to six months in prison and a £ 5,000 fine if found guilty under the wildlife and countryside act , the rspca said .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: farage to support thanet fight
text: former ukip leader nigel farage , campaigning in clacton for the party 's candidate paul oakley , took time out to discuss conservative candidate craig mackinlay , who has been charged with allegedly breaking election spending rules .
mr mackinlay is seeking to retain his seat in thanet south , which he won by beating nigel farage in 2015 .

mr farage said it would be unlikely that many residents in thanet south would vote for him and it would then be a straight fight between labour and ukip , so he said he would be heading there to offer his support .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: in the news : shame of church clerk who stole £ 10k
text: here is the front page of today 's essex edition of the east anglian daily times .
author: East Anglian Daily Times

documents.title: man charged with betting shop robberies
text: a man has been charged with two robberies at bookmakers in hertfordshire and essex ,
a female worker was sprayed in the face during one of the incidents , at the coral store in elizabeth road , bishop 's stortford , on the evening of monday , 29 may .
as we reported on tuesday , it is not yet known if the victim has suffered permanent eye damage and police said they were working to establish what the substance was .
a 51-year-old has been charged with two counts of robbery .
the second charge relates to a robbery at jennings bookmakers in clacton-on-sea on 14 may .
the man is due to appear at hatfield remand court today .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance crews 'feel vulnerable '' to assault over drugs
text: after an east of england ambulance service paramedic was attacked and threatened with a knife while on duty in jaywick earlier this week by a man demanding drugs , another staff member said the situation was always at the back of the minds of crew members .
dil patel believes most crews can feel vulnerable because ambulances carry drugs which are needed to help patients .
`` you do have training on how to face threats , the risks involved and what to do in the case of attack .
`` the drugs we have are locked away and are accessible when we need them but we no longer carry them on our person .
`` there is always a risk of attack or assault by people wanting these drugs , '' he said .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: call for action on ambulance attacks
text: violence against medical staff should be made a specific criminal offence , according to the royal college of nursing ( rcn ) .
an east of england ambulance paramedic had a knife held to his neck in jaywick by someone demanding drugs .
rcn spokesman tony durkin told bbc essex that protection of crews was not all about punitive action .
`` the vast majority of physical assaults on staff are by people who are victims of drug addiction .
`` even though we work extraordinarily well with other emergency services it is really difficult to get a prosecution if the person is physically unwell because of their addiction , '' he said .

documents.title: farage accuses carswell of damaging party
text: former uk independence party leader and founder member nigel farage has told bbc essex that ex-clacton mp douglas carswell damaged the party by `` not really believing '' in ukip .
nigel farage tells bbc essex that @ twitterid did more damage to # ukip in # clacton than @ twitterid
which face done the damage nigel ?

documents.title: crossrail project disruption 'forcing businesses to close '
text: the crossrail project has had a huge impact on the town of shenfield which will be a major terminus on the £ 15bn project to east transport across the south of england .
but the project has not been a positive experience for all .
one shop owner has told bbc essex the disruption caused by the work has forced some businesses in shenfield to close .
up to 900 people a day have been working on the new train line , which will eventually link the town to heathrow via central london .
kay thurgood runs a gift shop and says shoppers are n't coming .
`` we 've lost an enormous number of car parking spaces and if you do n't have places for people to park you do not have customers .
`` over the past two-and-a-half years we 've lost 20 % of our footfall and this has forced many businesses to close , '' she said .
crossrail , tfl and network rail said no-one was available to comment but work in shenfield 's due to finish by the end of the summer .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: seat belt crackdown nets more than 100 motorists
text: more than 100 drivers were caught at the wheel on essex roads without a seat belt in a crackdown on wednesday and three men were arrested on sus of drug driving .
police carried out the operation in waltham abbey `` as part of a dedicated operation to help to reduce those killed and seriously injured , '' a spokesman said .

in addition to 108 drivers dealt with for failing to wear a seat belt , 49 others were found using their mobile phone , including a driving instructor using a mobile phone whilst supervising a learner driver .
a further 71 drivers were stopped and dealt with for driving in excess of the speed limit .

`` officers arrested three drivers , a 49-year-old man from london , a 32-year-old man from hertfordshire and a 29-year-old man from london , on sus of driving under the influence of drugs , '' the spokesman said .
four drivers were also found to be driving without valid insurance and each driver had their car seized under section 165 .
a further four drivers were found to be driving without a valid mot and one driver was found to be driving without a valid licence .
essex police say more than 100 motorists have been caught driving without a seat belt during a road safety operation in waltham abbey .

BBC News

documents.title: weather : hot and humid with threat of thunderstorms
text: hot and humid conditions will trigger heavy showers and thunderstorms during the afternoon in many places .
not all areas will get them but where they do it could lead to surface water flooding and difficult driving conditions .
heavy showers will ease during the evening but more are possible during the early hours near to the coast .
minimum temperature : 15c ( 59f )
more details from bbc weather :
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to friday 's updates for essex
text: good morning from the team bringing you the live news page for essex .
between now and 18:00 , the team here will bring you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as we get them .
here are a couple of stories we 'll be following up .
the east of england ambulance service tells bbc essex how it is keeping staff safe after a paramedic was assaulted in jaywick .
work on the massive crossrail project has brought problems for shenfield - a major terminus - and we look at how residents and businesses are coping .
it is a bright and sunny start to the day but there may be thunderstorms on the horizon - more on that next from elizabeth rizzini .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for today 's live feed across essex .
highlights have included :
scroll down for all these and you can also follow the bbc essex general election debate which took place in thurrock this morning .

documents.title: promoter explains why he postponed weekend card
text: the boxing promoter behind saturday 's postponed card at braintree leisure centre says he had no choice but to cancel .
a combination of injuries to boxers and other problems meant some of the top fights could n't go ahead .
two suffolk boxers , ipswich 's fabio wardley and billy bird from sudbury ( had been due to fight on the night .
mervyn turner from shamrock boxing promotions says he was n't prepared to put on a below-par show for fans .
we had a fluke set of circumstances that just meant we could not provide a quality product and , if we ca n't do that , i do n't want the public turning up and being short-changed , '' he said .
`` i wo n't do it . ''
author: Cleah Hetherington
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: corbyn 's 'weak and wobbly ' quip in pitsea
text: the labour leader jeremy corbyn paraphrased theresa may 's `` strong and stable '' line while out campaigning in south essex in the basildon south & thurrock east constituency .
rapturous applause for @ twitterid at the end of his speech former mp @ twitterid on stage # ge2017
@ jeremycorbyn referring to the @ twitterid as `` the weak and wobbly party '' # pitsea # ge2017

pd pablo aka tom daley oozes style with his attempt slightly more elegant than his partner in crime fighting , pd nemo

documents.title: army and navy flyover could be set for improvements
text: the deputy leader of essex county council , kevin bentley , says highways bosses are hoping to make improvements to one of the county 's busiest junctions .
he 's looking at options for the one-lane army and navy flyover in chelmsford .
one of the possibilities is widening the road so it can take traffic in both directions at the same time .
several collisions have been seen on the structure .
`` in the short term , we are doing lots of work alleviating the roads around the chelmsford area , and that 's been out for consultation for some time , '' he said .
`` in the long term we would like to improve the army and navy . ''

documents.title: concord rangers chairman does n't want to comment on friendly cancellation
text: earlier we reported about billericay town 's friendly against concord rangers of canvey island being cancelled after `` negative comments '' were made on twitter .

billericay 's owner and manager glenn tamplin tweeted a statement saying comments made by concord 's chairman were personal to him , and the club did n't want their fans being exposed to `` such open negativity '' .
we 've asked concord rangers ' chairman ant smith if he wanted to make a comment on the cancellation , or mr tamlin 's remarks - he declined .

documents.title: video and snaps show tilbury power station demolition in progress
text: we 've seen these cracking on twitter of part of tilbury power station being demolished .
user @ twitterid who captured the images from across the river in kent , captioned them : `` 3,2,1 boom .
another part of tilbury power station comes down . ''
and here 's the video :

documents.title: 'getting the right deal will be challenging ' , corbyn tells pitsea audience
text: labour 's jeremy corbyn has told an audience in pitsea that a government under his leadership would take negotiations seriously and come away with a deal that worked for all of britain .
`` we in labour understand that getting the right deal - one that secures our country 's interest for the long term - will be challenging , '' he said .
`` labour is ready .
ready to deliver a deal that gives british business and british society the chance to thrive in a post-brexit world . ''
he also pledged to guarantee the right to remain in the uk for eu nationals already living here :
corbyn says first # brexit pledge will be giving eu nationals living in uk can remain and wants the same for brits on the continent # ge2017
2/2 # ge2017 suzy fowler-watt 's # corbyn interview , her comment at the end about him not realising how tough east vote is , patronising ! !

the soundbite clip does n't mention the rights of ex-pats .

documents.title: paramedic has knife held to throat in 'appalling incident ' in jaywick
text: a paramedic had a knife held to his throat by a man who demanded drugs in jaywick , leaving him with injuries to his neck and arm .
the east of england ambulance service says it was an unacceptable assault .
essex police has described it as an `` appalling incident '' .
it happened while the paramedic was working in brooklands just before 23:45 last night .
the man held a stanley knife to his neck and demanded drugs , which the paramedic refused to give him .
the east of england ambulance service said under no circumstances was it acceptable to assault its staff in the line of duty .
the suspect is described as white , around 6ft ( 1.8m ) tall and of medium build .

documents.title: jeremy corbyn arrives in pitsea
text: essex 's political reporter , simon dedman , is in attendance and said there was a big reaction to the arrival of the labour leader .
pitsea is part of the south basildon and east thurrock constituency where john baron is defending the seat he won in 2010 and 2015 .
@ jeremycorbyn arrives to standing ovation and nearly 2 mins applause in # pitsea # ge2017
ah another successful rent a crowd event idiots
lol what a bunch of fools

documents.title: essex football friendly called off after social media comments
text: billericay town have cancelled a pre-season friendly against fellow essex non-league side concord rangers after what 's been described as `` negative comments on social media '' .
the game was scheduled to take place next month .
concord rangers play in the national league south division , while billericay are below them in the football league pyramid in the ryman premier .
billericay 's owner and manager , glenn tamplin , sent this reply to a tweet from ant smith , who 's chairman of canvey-based concord :

in a statement on twitter , billericay town said : `` in light of these personal , negative comments , directed at glenn tamplin we do not feel it appropriate to expose our travelling supporters to such open negativity , particularly when the fixture was pitched as a pre-season 'friendly ' . ''
re arranged friendly due to unfortunate circumstances

documents.title: pets die in house fire
text: essex fire and rescue say a house fire in which four pets died started accidentally .
the blaze broke out in the kitchen of the property in eastern road , brightlingsea , yesterday evening .
two cats and two rabbits died in the blaze .
crews say they believe the fire started from cooking which had been left unattended .

documents.title: rail operator criticised for out-of-order toilets
text: the essex rail operator greater anglia has been criticised for putting on a service during rush hour where toilets were out of order .
it 's claimed some passengers had to urinate in bottles on the service between london liverpool street and norwich last month .
greater anglia says it 's unacceptable and has apologised .
zarvin wildley , a director at a law firm , was on the train :
zarvin was on his way home when men around him started weeing into bottles greater anglia has since apologised for the lack of loos .

documents.title: jeremy corbyn to make speech in basildon later
text: labour leader jeremy corbyn will appear in basildon later , where he 's expected to say theresa may 's approach to brexit risks `` a jobs meltdown '' .
mr corbyn will say mrs may has left the uk isolated and marginalised in europe and that she has `` needlessly alienated '' other eu countries .
as a result the risk of britain `` crashing out '' of the eu without a deal , he will say , is now much greater .

mrs may is returning to her key election message in a lunchtime speech - saying only the conservatives can secure a successful brexit , while the lib dems are hosting a rally discussing the impact of britain 's exit from the european union .
brexit was a major topic of discussion during bbc essex 's debate from the thurrock constituency this morning .

documents.title: four teens due in court after memorial garden for seven-year-old girl was vandalised
text: four teenagers are to appear in court after a memorial garden was damaged at a norwich school last month .
the garden , at valley primary academy , was planted in memory of summer grant .
the seven-year-old girl was killed in march 2016 when a bouncy castle was blown away in high winds at a funfair in harlow , essex .
four suspects , aged 16-18 , have been reported to court for criminal damage .
the date for their appearance has not been fixed yet .
summer 's father described whoever was responsible as being the `` scum of the earth '' .
two people , from cambridgeshire , were arrested by essex police last year on sus of manslaughter by gross negligence and they 're due to answer police bail later this month .

documents.title: weather : dry , warm and sunny
text: any early morning mist patches will soon clear , to bring a dry , bright and sunny day with light winds .
feeling slightly cooler towards the coast , but inland we can expect temperatures to reach 23c ( 73f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to thursday 's updates for essex
text: we 're starting later than usual today because of our coverage of a live general election debate from thurrock this morning .
three of the candidates from the main political parties joined us in purfleet - you can read a full run-down of what they said here .
from now until 18:00 , we 'll bring you the latest news , sport and weather from across essex , filling you in on all things election-related and otherwise .
author: Jodie Halford
BBC News

documents.title: boxing : suffolk fighters frustrated by postponement
text: two local boxers have been left disappointed after this saturday 's card at braintree leisure centre had to be called off .
sudbury 's billy bird ( and fabio wardley of ipswich were both scheduled to fight on the bill .
in a statement , shamrock promotions said : `` injuries and other problems meant that we lost some of the top fights on the card which could not be replaced at this late stage .
`` we have a reputation for putting on quality shows with bills full of competitive fights for our loyal fans and to offer any less would n't be consistent with our ethos . ''
bird is one of those affected by injury , and says he 's `` absolutely gutted '' to miss out on his first fight for over a year .
anyone who bought tickets is being advised to contact their point of sale for a full refund , with a further announcement due soon .
author: Brenner Woolley
BBC Radio Suffolk sport

documents.title: replacement train 'reason behind locked loos '
text: greater anglia explains that disruption to services is the reason why passengers faced locked loos on a recent journey .
a spokesman for the rail operator says that rather than cancel the 18:10 london to norwich service on 19 may , an alternative train was used - but in one section the toilets were out of order .
it explains that it 's very rare for all the loos on a train to be out of order and if this happens , they decide whether to cancel the train or warn customers .
we apologise for anyone who has suffered as a result .
however we 'd like to reassure all customers that on an average day , only a very small percentage of our train toilets are out of order . ''

documents.title: rail passengers caught short
text: greater anglia says it 's upgrading toilets after people were forced to use empty bottles to relieve themselves .
passengers claim all the loos were locked on the 18:10 london liverpool street train to norwich on friday , 19 may .
the rail operator has apologised for the error , saying it has a `` daily focus '' of ensuring train toilets are working and clean and is installing fully accessible loos on 30 more of its trains .

documents.title: that 's all from local live
text: that 's all from the team here for today - unless a major story breaks overnight in which case this live feed will be updated .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow , but if you want to get in touch in the meantime then hit the get involved button at the top of this page .
have a good evening .

documents.title: council fined £ 150,000 for data breach
text: council fined £ 150,000 for data breach

documents.title: overnight weather : mainly dry as showers die away
text: a mainly dry evening with the chance of a few light showers across the southern part of the region .
isolated showers will die away , leaving clear skies overnight with some mist patches developing .
lows of 11c ( 52f ) .
thursday will stay dry with sunny spells , feeling warm with a top temperature of 23c ( 73f ) inland , but fresher on the coast .
get the full forecast where you live from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: jack monroe 's 'blind date ' with made in chelsea star
text: essex food blogger jack monroe says her election `` blind date '' with made in chelsea star toff , real name georgia toffolo , `` went well '' despite their many differences .
the pair sat down for dinner for a feature on the bbc 's victoria derbyshire programme , which aims to bring people together from opposite sides of the political debate .
she said that toff was friendly but that she found some of her views on welfare `` difficult to listen to as someone who had quite a difficult time on benefits '' .
monroe , 29 , intended to stand as a general election candidate for the national health action party in the southend west seat but called it off after receiving hate mail .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: £ 150,000 fine for council which published sensitive information
text: a council has been fined £ 150,000 for publishing sensitive personal information about a family on its website .
basildon council released information about a traveller family 's disabilities , including mental health issues , in a planning application .
the information commissioner 's office ( ico ) says the the council failed to remove personal data .
the council said it was taking legal advice and had 28 days to appeal .
the ico said basildon council breached the data protection act when it published the information in planning application documents which it made publicly available online .
its investigation found that on 16 july 2015 , the council received a written statement in support of the family 's planning application for proposed works in a green belt .
the statement contained sensitive personal data relating to a static traveller family who had been living on the site for many years .

an inexperienced council officer did not notice the personal information in the statement , and there was no procedure in place for a second person to check it before the personal data was published online ,
the information was only removed on 4 september 2015 when the concerns came to light .
ico enforcement manager sally anne poole said : `` this was a serious incident in which highly sensitive personal data , including medical information , was made publicly available .
`` planning applications in themselves can be controversial and emotive , so to include such sensitive information and leave it out there for all to see for several weeks is simply unacceptable . ''
a basildon council spokesman said : `` the council has been given 28 days in which to lodge an appeal against this decision .
we are taking advice and considering our position . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: crewe sign colchester striker porter
text: crewe sign colchester striker porter

documents.title: council fined for publishing sensitive information about family
text: a council has been fined £ 150,000 for publishing sensitive personal information about a family on its website .
basildon council released information about a traveller family 's disabilities , including mental health issues , in its planning application for work in a green belt .
the information commissioner 's office ( ico ) says the council failed to remove personal data .
a basildon council spokesman said : `` the council has been given 28 days in which to lodge an appeal against this decision .
we are taking advice and considering our position . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: your lots of essex sunshine
text: there 's a fair amount of cloud around today , but with plenty of sunshine breaking through across the county , as captured by our bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: braintree offer new contracts to 18
text: braintree offer new contracts to 18

documents.title: suspected illegal immigrants found in lorry
text: we reported earlier about the detention of a group of people found in a lorry at the fortune of war roundabout in laindon last night .
the home office has now given us more details .
a spokeswoman said : `` immigration enforcement was contacted by essex police after officers attended an incident on the a127 in basildon .
`` police officers arrested seven men , who presented themselves as being from iraq and iran , on sus of illegal entry .
`` all were referred to the home office and their cases will be progressed in line with the immigration rules .
`` one minor was referred to the care of social services . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: cleaner is caught stealing on camera
text: cleaner is caught stealing on camera

documents.title: policeman denies assaulting prisoner
text: a police officer accused of beating a prisoner in a custody cell has pleaded not guilty to common assault .
pc john senior was charged following a review of cctv footage at chelmsford police station by the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) .
the charge relates to allegations that a prisoner was kicked in the head , face and arms a number of times .
essex police said the incident happened on 1 november after the man was arrested and detained in chelmsford .
mr senior appeared before magistrates in ipswich this morning and is due back there on 26 june .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: suspected illegal immigrants found in lorry
text: eight people have been detained after being found in the back of a lorry in laindon .
police were called to a vehicle on the a127 at the fortune of war roundabout at 20:00 last night .
they say the group was handed over to border force officials on sus of immigration offences .
police carried out a search in the area but no further people were detained and the driver was not arrested .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: autism charity condemns teenager attack
text: there are calls for better awareness of autism after a schoolboy with the condition was attacked in benfleet .
robert palmer says his 13-year-old step-son jack was punched in the head after he was asked out to play on monday .
essex police says inquiries are ongoing .
tom purser , from the national autistic society , said : `` sadly we know it 's all too common that children with autism experience bullying in school and , in this case , outside of school .
`` we think it comes from a complete lack of understanding of autism .
`` a lot of people are aware of autism but do n't have that proper understanding to realise that autistic children and adults can experience the world very differently to other people . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: 'challenging ' weekend for ambulance service
text: the number of calls for an ambulance in our region over the bank holiday weekend was 10 % higher than during the same period last year .
east of england ambulance service said that essex was its busiest county , with more than 3,700 calls in the four days between friday and monday , up from 3,390 in 2016 .
kevin brown , director of service delivery , said : `` we continue to experience high levels of demand and this bank holiday weekend was no exception .
`` we responded to some very challenging incidents for our staff .
`` we continue to remind people to only call us in a genuine emergency and to consider the use of gps , pharmacists , walk in centres , urgent care centres and other forms of self-help . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: man jailed for unprovoked pub attack
text: a man has been jailed for four years for attacking another man with a glass .
aaron yates struck his victim , now aged 27 , in the face at the former bar sport in braintree high street on 12 october 2014 , leaving him permanently scarred .
the 28-year-old , of douglas grove , witham , was found guilty at chelmsford crown court of committing grievous bodily harm .
det con nicholas campbell said : `` yates was fuelled by alcohol when he launched an unprovoked attack on an innocent man who was enjoying a night out .
`` there is no place for this type of thuggish behaviour and he now has time to reflect on his behaviour behind bars . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: vintage planes added to clacton airshow line-up
text: the battle of britain memorial flight ( bbmf ) has been confirmed for this year 's clacton airshow .
the display , including the lancaster , spitfire and hurricane , will take place on the seafront on 24 and 25 august .
the aircraft are regularly seen at events commemorating world war two , on british state occasions such as the trooping the colour and the queen 's birthday celebrations .

nigel brown , from tendring district council , said : `` whatever excitement the newer fighter jets and bombers bring to the crowds , it is always a special moment when this particular display makes its flypast .
`` it is especially nostalgic for those with any personal memories of the second world war and many spectators turn out for the chance to see the bbmf in all its glory . ''
essex will be supplying commentary at the event with radio airshow .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: essex hospital changes would 'improve patient safety '
text: health bosses in essex have disputed claims by campaigners that southend 's accident and emergency department is to be downgraded .
they insist that southend will retain its a & e and that , in addition , basildon could become a 24-hour specialist emergency hospital .

dr celia skinner , chief medical officer at southend hospital , said : `` in all of the options currently being discussed , around 95 % of hospital visits would remain local at each hospital and there would continue to be an a & e , supervised by consultants and open 24/7 at each of the three hospitals .
`` in line with national guidance , we are also seeking to designate one hospital , possibly basildon , to be a 24 hour specialist emergency hospital .

`` this would ensure immediate 24 hour access to state-of-the art specialist scans and treatments , which is not always possible in a general hospital a & e , where staff manage a broad range of conditions .
`` we want to be certain of achieving improvements in patient care and safety .
any potential changes in services would happen safely in stages , over several years . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: 'people will die ' under southend hospital plans
text: campaigners have claimed that health bosses are planning to downgrade the accident and emergency department at southend hospital .
a group called save southend a and e has said that all emergency cases would be treated in basildon instead .
the group 's secretary , mike fieldhouse , said : `` we 've spoken to many health professionals at southend and they say these ideas are badly thought out .
`` there are improvements to be made but we think what 's laid out in the transformation plans here is not the way forward .
`` we have evidence that people will die because of what is possibly being planned here . ''
hospital bosses say no decision has been made on the future of the a & e department .
we 'll bring you their full response shortly .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: wednesday 's weather
text: after a cooler start it should warm up during the day .
it 'll be bright rather than blazing sunshine , although there should be some breaks in the cloud to give us some sunny spells .
there are a few showers around , although they 're fairly isolated and should be quite light , so many of us across the region will have a dry day , with a top temperature of 21c ( 70f ) .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning
text: hello and welcome to wednesday 's live updates for essex .
we 'll be here until 18:00 with the latest news , sport , travel and weather for the county .
there 's a full weather forecast coming up and , spoiler alert , there should be some sunshine .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: our live coverage today
text: that 's it for our live updates , thank you for joining us .
we 'll be back again from 08:00 tomorrow .
until then , here 's a quick recap of some of our main stories :
scroll down for more .
have a great evening .

documents.title: stansted terror suspect appears in court
text: stansted terror suspect appears in court

documents.title: pet hamster undergoes 'lifesaving ' op
text: pet hamster undergoes 'lifesaving ' op

documents.title: actresses wanted for company 's debut show
text: budding actresses are needed for a new production company 's debut show .
princes actors company is calling for females aged between 14 and 21 its performance of the girls like that by evan placey .
it is an ensemble play exploring the pressure on young people today in the wake of advancing technology .
auditions are due to take place on 27 june with the full performance at the princes theatre in clacton in september .

director melissa wenn , who recently set up the company at the tendring district council-run theatre , said : `` it is a chance to be in on the very start of this venture which also includes workshops with professional practitioners which will run throughout the year at the princes theatre . ''

documents.title: harlow murder inquiry : police name victim
text: a man who died after he was found with head injuries in a car has been named as andrej arhipovs .
a post-mortem examination reveled the 39-year-old from harlow died as a result as a head injury .
he was found inside a volvo in milwards , harlow , at about 23:25 on sunday .
he died a few hours later at princess alexandra hospital .
a 24-year-old man from bishop 's stortford and two men aged 35 and 40 from harlow were arrested on sus of murder .
they have been released under investigation and police continue to investigate the circumstances leading up to mr arhipovs ' death .

documents.title: election panel : best way forward for the elderly
text: in the run up to the general election , the bbc is running an election panel .
we 've been asking members of the public for their views on key issues .
we asked :
how should we ensure that the elderly are properly cared for ?
what should we do about pensions ?
which party do you think has the best policies to support us in our later life ?
and you said :
simon , chelmsford : `` labour have the most comprehensive solution , though the most expensive .
we should all pay a little extra on ni contributions to fill the gap . ''
julia , northampton : `` more state run care provision , pensions need to be kept in line with inflation , i think the lib deems have the best policies . ''
frances , norwich : `` ensure that those who have saved their hard earned assets retain them to benefit themselves if and when care is needed .
i think that both the labour and green party are more likely to provide the best policies for elderly care . ''
vijay , peterborough : `` pensions should be increased and those people who have saved fur their old age should not be penalised .
no party has addressed this issue to my satisfaction . ''
sandra , ipswich : `` no party really has it nailed but i think labour have the best offering at the present moment in time .
i 'm not a politician so have no idea how it can be done , but there are ways , as have been shown in the past , to help the elderly . ''

documents.title: power outage causes 'disastrous ' end to music festival
text: a music festival was forced to end prematurely when `` disaster struck '' and there was a power outage .
organisers of the soul crusade festival in southend said the generator `` surged '' and `` fried half a million pounds worth of sound and lighting '' .
they said they will offer half price tickets to everyone who attended saturday 's event for their christmas event .
headliners soul ii soul have agreed to perform at the christmas soul crusade .
in a statement , the organisers said : `` soul crusade festival is an event we have passionately worked on since november last year and to say we are devastated is an understatement .
`` it 's something we never in a million years thought would happen and are truly sorry for spoiling the end of the show . ''

documents.title: football : atkinson signs for the stags
text: southend united footballer will atkinson has signed for mansfield town .
the 28-year-old midfielder celebrated promotion twice with the blues .
he previously spent a month on loan at mansfield in 2008 , making 12 appearances in the amber and blue .

documents.title: stags sign southend midfielder atkinson
text: stags sign southend midfielder atkinson

documents.title: man charged with terror offences after stansted airport arrest
text: a 37-year-old man has been charged under the terrorism act after being arrested at stansted airport .
aweys faqey of north london was charged today with preparing acts of terrorism , following his arrest a week earlier .
he is due to appear at westminster magistrates ' court later .

documents.title: men quizzed over harlow murder
text: police are continuing to question three men in connection with a murder in harlow .
a 39-year-old man was found with head injuries in a volvo in milwards , harlow , at about 23:45 bst on sunday .
he was taken by paramedics to princess alexandra hospital , harlow , where he died in the early hours of the morning .
police are still questioning three men in connection with the incident .

documents.title: 'garden for all ' opens at city college
text: a wheelchair-friendly garden which is designed to give students an outdoor learning experience has been officially opened .
it has been created at chelmsford college and features raised beds to make it accessible for disabled students and children from nearby dovedale nursery .
chelmsford college said the secret garden was `` perfect '' for inviting the members of the community to join in with outdoor events including fetes , afternoon teas and coffee mornings .
the project was supported by tesco `` bags of help '' grant .

documents.title: quad bike rider has 'life changing ' injuries
text: a quad bike rider is being treated for a serious head injury after a crash in south essex .
it happened on the a1306 at north stifford yesterday at about 13:20 .
essex police said it is thought the rider has suffered `` life-changing '' injuries .
detectives want to speak to the driver of a black or grey saloon style vehicle .

documents.title: residents describe events in harlow
text: harlow residents have been talking about events in the town after a man was found with head injuries in a car at milwards late on sunday night .
the 39-year-old died a few hours later in hospital .
one man , who witnessed the aftermatch , said : `` around about midnight we saw the helicopter flying up above us .
`` the spotlight was very bright and it was shining around so we all looked out of the window as you do .
`` the helicopter went up and down and round and round for about 10 minutes then i think it landed on the field . ''

documents.title: big rise in firearm and shotgun certificate renewals
text: the number of firearm and shotgun certificates renewed by essex police has more than doubled over the last few years .
data handed to bbc essex reveals more than 1,600 licences were renewed in 2014 , while the figure for 2017 is already more than 3,200 .

paul bates , the firearms licensing manager at essex police , says it 's partly because of a surge in the popularity of clay pigeon shooting : `` the majority for shotguns are for recreational purposes .
`` clay pigeon shooting is the sport of the moment i think , the way it 's going , '' he said .
`` there are more people gaining access to land for vermin shooting as well and they 're all quite keen to possess their own guns to do it . ''

documents.title: coffee break mums share election views
text: coffee break mums share election views

documents.title: tuesday 's weather : quite cloudy but some bright spells too
text: there 's quite a lot of cloud around but i think as the day continues we 'll see some bright spells coming through , not lots and lots of sunshine but some breaks in the cloud through the day .
there may be an occasional touch of drizzle , maybe the odd light shower but nothing more than that .
top temperature across the bbc east region 19c ( 66f ) .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Sara Thornton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning essex
text: thanks for joining us , it 's great to have your company .
investigations are continuing into the death of a man who was discovered with head injuries in milwards , harlow , late on sunday night .
elsewhere there 's been a rise in the number of gun licences handed out in the county , according to data handed exclusively to bbc essex .
we 'll start the day in our time-honoured way though , with a look at the day 's weather prospects .
sara thornton will bring us those next .

documents.title: rain halts surrey and essex contest
text: rain halts surrey and essex contest

documents.title: surrey rewarded with the new ballsurrey 369 v essex 270-5 ( 98.2 overs )
text: it 's been a fascinating morning at chelmsford .
tom curran has bowled an outstanding spell from the hayes close end and was rewarded when he nipped one back and knocked out ravi bopara 's off stump for 39 .
dan lawrence , with his wrists of gold , moved to a tremendous century .
lawrence played extremely well and possesses batting gifts that are difficult to teach .
but on 107 he was trapped lbw by stuart meaker to reward surrey for a disciplined display with the new ball .
author: Mark Church
BBC Radio London commentator

documents.title: former homeless woman to row around uk
text: former homeless woman to row around uk

documents.title: essex reply well after sangakkara 200
text: essex reply well after sangakkara 200

documents.title: disciplined session from surrey bowlersessex 135-3 ( 49.1 overs ) v surrey 369
text: before tea , surrey 's bowlers made life very hard for the essex batsmen in the afternoon session .
tom curran trapped alastair cook in the second over after lunch for 36 and runs were at a premium .
tom westley was caught behind off sam curran for 16 and amar virdi bowled with great control on his surrey debut .
and nick browne , who had battled to 52 , pulled meaker to tom curran to finish off an excellent couple of hours for the visitors .
author: Mark Church
BBC Radio London commentator

documents.title: sangakkara 200 an innings to savoursurrey 369 all out v essex
text: kumar sangakkara 's double hundred was a masterpiece .
arriving at the crease with surrey 9-2 yesterday he was the final man to go for 200 , his highest score for surrey .
stuart meaker 's 49 was a vital contribution and from 31-5 , surrey will be delighted to make 369 .
whatever happens in this game , sangakkara 's effort will be remembered for the way his runs were scored and the match situation when he scored them .
author: Mark Church
BBC Radio London commentator

text: sangakkara shines with fifth ton in row
